headings.title: Unveiling the Mythical Fury: Maui’s Wildfires Rage On, Challenging Firefighting Efforts

summary: Unveiling the Mythical Fury: Maui’s Wildfires Rage On, Challenging Firefighting Efforts Maui, August 12, 2023 — The picturesque paradise of Maui is facing an unprecedented natural catastrophe as wildfires continue to rage across the island, leaving authorities and residents grappling with a unique set of challenges. Unlike typical wildfire scenarios, the flames have taken on an almost mythic quality, prompting locals to dub them “Pele’s Breath,” in reference to the Hawaiian goddess of fire and volcanoes.
title: Maui's Wildfires Rage On, Challenging Firefighting Efforts

summary: Headlines Six people have been killed in wildfires in Maui. Broadband internet outage across Hawaii. Violent wind across Hawaii from Maui burning. 150,000 gallons of water spray dropped yet to stop burning but no outcome yet. US Miltery top on the race to deploy firefighters to save Maui and Big Islands. Copast guards from US is saving life to do water rescue. People run into the ocean to save life. Fires is continuing and not under control.
title: Disaster dealy wildfire acroos Maui

headings.title: How long we retain your data
What rights do you have over your data?
Who do we share your data with

summary:
Who we are We are Bdmeter, located in NYC, United States. We are one of the largest information services providers of real-time global information, technology, business, innovations, changes, ideas, thinking, and the future.
Comments When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.
An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it.
title: Privacy Policy
